title: SpaceX Falcon 9 rockets scheduled to launch five Starlink missions in a row
summary: In lieu of commercial missions ready to fly, SpaceX Falcon 9 rockets are currently scheduled to launch at least five batches of...

title: U.S. and Europe say space cooperation with Russia not affected yet by Ukraine crisis
summary: American and European officials said Feb. 23 that space cooperation with Russia remains unaffected even as that country continues to threaten a full-scale invasion of Ukraine.

title: Space Force procurement command trying to bring ‘unity of effort’ to space programs
summary: Claire Leon, a former Boeing executive who previously led the national security space launch program, is now in charge of a new office that will coordinate military space programs.

title: Dmitry Rogozin says he does not appreciate “openly hostile” US policy
summary: "I am very unhappy with the openly hostile policy of the USA toward my country."

title: Moon-bound rocket stage still most likely from 2014 Chang’e mission, despite China’s denial
summary: A rocket stage expected to impact the moon is still most likely to belong to China’s 2014 moon mission, despite a denial from the country’s Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

title: NASA to Host Virtual Future of Aviation Showcase
summary: Members of the media and public are invited to participate in NASA’s imaginAviation, a three-day virtual event that will focus on the future transformation of aviation that begins Tuesday, March 1.

title: NASA, Axiom to Discuss First Private Astronaut Space Station Mission
summary: NASA experts will join a virtual news conference hosted by Axiom Space to preview the launch of Axiom Mission 1 (Ax-1), the first private astronaut mission to the International Space Station. The briefing will take place at 11 a.m. EST Monday, Feb. 28.

title: Northrop Grumman wins $341 million Space Force contract to develop a deep-space tracking radar
summary: The U.S. Space Force awarded Northrop Grumman a $341 million contract to develop a radar site to track active satellites and debris in high orbits.

title: NRO warns satellite operators of possible Russian attacks
summary: The director of the National Reconnaissance Office, Christopher Scolese, warned that Russia’s military could target satellites in space to disrupt communications and GPS services.

title: Virgin Galactic has lost $1 billion during the last two years
